meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's your boy, reviewing Cat Quest like it's nobody's business.

Before I get into the nitty-gritty, let me just say that Cat Quest is a game that's all about cats. Like, really all about cats. If you're not a cat person, then... well, maybe this isn't the game for you (just kidding, I'm sure there are plenty of dog people out there who can appreciate the feline fun). But seriously, if you enjoy RPGs and have a soft spot for adorable kitties, then Cat Quest is definitely worth checking out.

Now, let's get to the good stuff. The gameplay in Cat Quest is surprisingly solid. You control a cat (because, duh) as it explores various environments, battles monsters, and collects loot. It's a pretty straightforward action RPG setup, but one that's easy to get into and has just enough depth to keep you engaged.

The visuals are where Cat Quest really shines, though. The game is full of cute, colorful characters and environments, and the animations are top-notch. You'll find yourself giggling at the silly cat antics and giddy with excitement when your feline friend pulls off a particularly impressive combo attack (I mean, who doesn't love a good "paws-itive" pun?).

Of course, no review would be complete without throwing some shade at our fellow critics. I mean, come on, Worth Playing, you're saying it's best enjoyed in bursts because of the repetitive quest structure? Boo! That means missing out on all the fun cat puns (see what I did there?). And don't even get me started on Digitally Downloaded's " Cat Quest is a reductive game that strips the RPG formula to its very roots" – I mean, isn't that just a nice way of saying it's simple and accessible?

In conclusion, if you're looking for a lighthearted, fun RPG with some seriously adorable cat charm, then Cat Quest is definitely worth checking out. Just don't expect it to be too deep or complex – this game is all about having a good time, and that's purr-fectly fine by me!
